intro: Eclopes paleacea, commonly known as the paleaceae plant, is a flowering species native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. The flowers are typically pale in color, giving the plant its common name.
